summary: Lucas Moran was a representative of the Movimiento Democrata Cristiano in Cuba. Documents from 1961 indicate that letters were sent to him by the JHWAVE base. Concerns arose regarding the source of these letters and the protection of AMULLA-1, leading to the implementation of SECRET NOFORN controls on materials from AMULLA-1. He is mentioned in the context of Cuban operations, including propaganda and underground activities, funded by a budget of $81,500 in 1962.
significance: Lucas Moran's significance in the JFK context appears to be related to his role as a representative of the Movimiento Democrata Cristiano in Cuba and his involvement in covert operations and communications during the early 1960s. The documents suggest he was a point of contact for U.S. intelligence activities aimed at Cuban opposition groups.
